drinkName.name: Scarlet Glow
drinkName.about: The secret to this gorgeous tipple is chilled hibiscus tea.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice.

drinkName.name: Sangrita
drinkName.about: This savory concoction is the classic accompaniment to a shot of good tequila.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a pitcher and stir until the salt dissolves.
Let stand for 15 to 30 minutes and then remove and discard the jalapeño.
(The longer the jalapeño infuses, the spicier the Sangrita will be.) Store in the refrigerator. Serve as an accompaniment to shots of tequila.

drinkName.name: Lights Out Punch
drinkName.about: With tea-infused vermouth and tequila, this fizzy concoction is a cocktail-party champion.

ingredients.ingredient: MarketSpice Cinnamon-Orange Black Tea or other spiced black tea
Centinela Reposado Tequila or other reposado tequila, chilled
Fresh apple juice or cider, chilled
Demerara syrup (2 parts Demerara sugar, 1 part water), chilled
Fee Brothers Whiskey Barrel Aged Bitters, Fee Brothers Old Fashion Bitters or The Bitter Truth Old Time Aromatic Bitters

mix.how: At least 24 hours prior to kickoff, fill a plastic container (1-pint or 1-quart, depending on the size of your punch bowl) with water and add apple slices and cinnamon sticks if desired.
Freeze until solid.
Combine the tea and vermouth in a jar or other container and let stand for 90 minutes.
Strain, and refrigerate. On game day, combine the tea-infused vermouth and the remaining ingredients in a punch bowl, adding the soda last.
Carefully add the prepared ice block and garnish lavishly with apple slices and freshly grated cinnamon and nutmeg.

drinkName.name: Partida Paloma
drinkName.about: You need authentic Mexican grapefruit soda to make an authentic version of the tequila classic.

mix.how: Fill a highball glass with ice and add the tequila and salt.
Squeeze the lime half into the glass and drop into the drink.
Fill with grapefruit soda.

drinkName.name: La Perla
drinkName.about: This sophisticated sherry-and-tequila cocktail proves that the agave spirit can be elegant.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Cucumber & Rose Collins
drinkName.about: The classic Collins took a trip through the garden.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a tall glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a cucumber slice.

drinkName.name: Malena
drinkName.about: Rye whiskey, Campari and sweet port join forces in this delicious sipper.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir briefly and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice or a cocktail glass.
Garnish with an orange half-wheel and a dusting of ground cinnamon.

drinkName.name: Boston Rum Punch
drinkName.about: This delicious mix of rum and lemonade is a Beantown classic.

mix.how: Add the rum into a shaker with finely cracked ice and fill with lemonade, then shake briefly.
Pour (unstrained) into a pint glass.
Garnish with half a strawberry and an orange slice.

drinkName.name: Stoli O Seduction
drinkName.about: This citrusy drink will beguile you.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Garnish with a grapefruit wedge.

drinkName.name: Seven & Seven
drinkName.about: Together they make 14 and a sweet, sparkling whiskey drink.

mix.how: Add the ingredients to a highball glass filled with ice and stir gently.

drinkName.name: Milk & Honey
drinkName.about: This easy-to-make drink will take you to the Promised Land.

mix.how: Add the Bénédictine to a mug.
Fill with ice, top with cold milk and garnish with an orange slice and a cinnamon stick.
This cocktail can also be served hot. Simply �-warm up the milk and leave out the ice.).

drinkName.name: VeeVolette
drinkName.about: It’s like drinking a bouquet of flowers.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a mint sprig or edible flower.

drinkName.name: Orange You a Pistachio?
drinkName.about: Punny name. Serious drink.

mix.how: Add the tequila, orgeat and lime juice to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with the bitters.
Twist a piece of orange peel over the glass, rub it around the rim and drop it into the drink.

drinkName.name: 81 Old Fashioned
drinkName.about: This simple bourbon drink is pure old-school.

ingredients.ingredient: Demerara syrup (one part Demerara sugar, one part water)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with lemon and orange twists.

drinkName.name: Pronto Pronto Cocktail
drinkName.about: This Averna cocktail demands to be made immediately.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the lime juice and basil.
Add the remaining ingredients except the club soda and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into a highball glass.
Top with the soda and garnish with a basil leaf, lime wheel and lemon wheel.

drinkName.name: The Orkney Chapel
drinkName.about: This complex Scotch drink inspires reverence.

ingredients.ingredient: Highland Park 12-Year-Old Single Malt Scotch Whisky

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a cocktail or coupe glass.
Garnish with an orange peel.

drinkName.name: Golden Glove
drinkName.about: This extra-citrusy cousin of the Daiquiri gets a kick from Cointreau.

ingredients.ingredient: White rum (Flor de Caña 4-Year-Old Extra Dry)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass filled with crushed ice.
Garnish with a lime half-wheel.

drinkName.name: Skinny Superfruit Sangria
drinkName.about: At just 120 calories, this fruity sipper is tasty and good for your waistline.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and pour (unstrained) into a rocks glass.
Garnish with chunks of fresh seasonal fruit.

drinkName.name: Açaí Cosmo
drinkName.about: Try this rainforest spin on the classic Cosmo.

ingredients.ingredient: Grand Marnier or other orange liqueur

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist or a strawberry.

drinkName.name: Açaí Lemonade
drinkName.about: Served in a Mason jar, this refresher is a summertime staple.

mix.how: Fill a Mason jar with ice and add the VeeV.
Fill with lemonade and add a splash of cranberry juice.
Seal the jar, shake and garnish with a lemon half-wheel.

drinkName.name: French 65
drinkName.about: Try this extra-citrusy spin on the classic French 75.

mix.how: Add the Cointreau and bitters to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled Champagne flute.
Top with the Champagne and garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: Heated Affair
drinkName.about: This hot tequila-and-cider concoction will warm you head to toe.

mix.how: Add the tequila and cider to a pre-warmed Irish Coffee glass.
Float a little heavy cream on top and garnish with freshly grated nutmeg and a cinnamon stick.

drinkName.name: Apple Fool’s Martini
drinkName.about: A drink that tricks the eye and the palate.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the simple syrup and basil.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled martini glass.
Garnish with a thin apple slice or a maraschino cherry.

drinkName.name: The Sazerac Cocktail
drinkName.about: It doesn’t get much more classic than this NOLA standard.

mix.how: Pack an Old Fashioned glass with ice and set aside.
In a second Old Fashioned glass, muddle the sugar cube and bitters, and add the rye whiskey.
Pour the ice out of the first glass, add the Herbsaint and rotate the glass to coat the inside, discarding any excess.
Add the whiskey mixture to the prepared glass and garnish with a lemon peel.

drinkName.name: Calvados Sidecar
drinkName.about: Get introduced to French apple brandy with this simple variation on a classic.

mix.how: Combine equal amounts of cinnamon and sugar on a small saucer.
Rub the rim of a cocktail glass with the lime or lemon wedge and dip carefully into the sugar mixture so that only the very top of the rim is coated evenly.
Place the glass into the freezer to let the sugar rim harden.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: Cinnamon Syrup
drinkName.about: Cinnamon syrup which is used in other recipes

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a small saucepan.
Bring to a boil over high heat, reduce heat to low and simmer for a few minutes.
Remove from heat, cover, and let stand for at least 6 hours.
Strain, and store in the refrigerator.

drinkName.name: Vermiglio
drinkName.about: This bitter-and-sweet cocktail calls for lots of shaking.

ingredients.ingredient: Simple syrup (one part sugar, one part water)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the bitters to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake hard and strain into a pint glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with the bitters.

drinkName.name: Herradura Tequila Luxe
drinkName.about: A quick and easy version of the Margarita with a refreshing lemon-lime flavor.

mix.how: In a rocks glass, muddle the lime and lemon wedges.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and pour (unstrained) into the prepared glass.

drinkName.name: Stoli O Main Squeeze
drinkName.about: This variation on the Screwdriver is packed with citrus flavor.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a tall glass and fill with ice.
Fill with club soda and stir.
Garnish with an orange wheel.

drinkName.name: La Tour Eiffel
drinkName.about: Cocktail expert Gary Regan imagines what the Sazerac would be like if invented in France instead of New Orleans.

mix.how: Pour the absinthe into a chilled Champagne flute, tilting and rotating the glass to coat the interior.
Add a few ice cubes and set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with fresh ice.
Stir.
Discard the ice and any excess absinthe from the prepared flute and strain the drink into it.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Spring’s First Bloom
drinkName.about: So good that even the daffodils take notice.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and double strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a single mint or microgreen leaf.

drinkName.name: Tallulah
drinkName.about: This simple but delicious drink was inspired by the Southern tradition of adding peanuts to a can of Coke.

mix.how: Add the whiskey and orgeat to a rocks glass and stir until well combined.
Fill with ice and top with the Coca-Cola.
Garnish with a small handful of salted peanuts.

drinkName.name: Raspberry Bellini
drinkName.about: A simple addition to the classic recipe yields huge flavor.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a Champagne flute.

drinkName.name: French 75
drinkName.about: Possibly named for a World War I field gun, this classic drink packs a wallop.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and fine-strain into a Champagne flute.
Top with the Champagne and garnish with a long ribbon of lemon peel.

drinkName.name: Tullamore Dew Irish Coffee
drinkName.about: Salute the Emerald Isle with this spirited cup of joe.

mix.how: Fill a coffee mug or heat-proof glass with very hot water to warm it and then discard the water.
Fill the mug or glass about three-quarters of the way with coffee.
Drop in the sugar cubes and stir until thoroughly dissolved.
Add the whiskey and top with lightly whipped cream.

drinkName.name: Inter Continental
drinkName.about: If you’re worldly and you know it, drink this cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Scofflaw
drinkName.about: This whiskey drink was invented in Paris while the US suffered through Prohibition.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

drinkName.name: Patrón Perfect Cosmo
drinkName.about: Like Cosmopolitans? Try this flavorful and easy tequila version of the drink.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Leblon Brazillionaire
drinkName.about: This cocktail was a Judges Choice Winner and was named Best in Show at the 2010 Wine & Spirits Wholesalers of America Convention.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with two cherries on a cocktail pick or skewer.

drinkName.name: Cielo Rosso
drinkName.about: A refreshing Campari-and-vodka drink with a tangy grapefruit twist.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist and a fresh basil leaf.

drinkName.name: Dubonnet and Champagne
drinkName.about: Simple but elegant.

mix.how: Add both ingredients to a Champagne flute.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Hudson Rob Roy
drinkName.about: Mix up this version of the Scottish classic made with single malt whiskey distilled in upstate New York.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir well.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a cherry or lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Blanco & Tonic
drinkName.about: Crisp, cool and chock full of tequila.

mix.how: Pour Don Julio Blanco Tequila into a highball glass filled with ice.
Top off with tonic water.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Orange Poppy
drinkName.about: Try this fizzy absinthe drink.

mix.how: Squeeze the orange wedge into a shaker.
Add the absinthe and triple sec, and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and pour (unstrained) into a tall glass.
Top with the lemon-lime soda and garnish with a mint sprig and orange wheel.

drinkName.name: Rubia Bonita
drinkName.about: Muddled strawberries and cilantro bring out tequila’s fresh side.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the cilantro, strawberries and lime juice.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake for 10 seconds and double strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with an additional strawberry and a few cilantro sprigs.

drinkName.name: Billionaire
drinkName.about: Feeling spendy? Try this deluxe cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon wheel.

drinkName.name: Berri Sophisticated
drinkName.about: This punny cocktail is Absolut-ly delectable.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the blueberries.
Add the vodka, lime juice and simple syrup, and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Champagne flute.
Top with Champagne and garnish with 3 blueberries on a toothpick.

drinkName.name: Clover Club
drinkName.about: This pre-Prohibition classic is one of Philadelphia’s contributions to mixological history.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with 3 speared raspberries.
*Instead of raspberry syrup, you can muddle 3 or 4 fresh raspberries and 1/2 oz simple syrup (1 part sugar, 1 part water).

drinkName.name: Caborita
drinkName.about: Want to party like Sammy Hagar? Try his signature Margarita recipe.

mix.how: Coat the rim of a large Margarita glass with salt.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Garrick Club Punch
drinkName.about: Garrick Club Punch tasted as good in 1835 as it does today.

mix.how: Peel the lemons with a vegetable peeler, avoiding the white pith.
Muddle the peels with the sugar in a 3-quart pitcher or punch bowl and let stand for 30 minutes.
Add the lemon juice and stir until the sugar has dissolved.
Add the gin and Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur or Grand Marnier, and stir.
Fill the pitcher or bowl halfway with ice and add the seltzer or club soda.
Stir again and serve in individual punch or highball glasses.

drinkName.name: Old Jamaican
drinkName.about: Respect your elders.

mix.how: In a shaker, gently muddle the mint and lime juice.
Add the remaining ingredients except the Champagne and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with Champagne and garnish with a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Gibson
drinkName.about: The Martini‘s savory second cousin, the Gibson, uses a pickled cocktail onion in place of the typical briny olive to add an umami undertone to the classic cocktail. The Gibson is believed to have been created by San Francisco businessman Walter D.K. Gibson in the late 1800s, who thought that eating onions prevented colds, hence the addition of the mini allium.

ingredients.ingredient:
Gin or vodka
Try it with Plymouth

mix.how: Add the ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a cocktail onion.

drinkName.name: Francophile
drinkName.about: Say merci beaucoup to a glass of this warm wine-based drink.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a small saucepan.
Cook over medium heat until hot.
Pour into a thick-walled mug and garnish with an apple slice and a cinnamon stick.

drinkName.name: Dried Apricot Martini
drinkName.about: With peach liqueur and apricot, this vodka drink is packed with fruit flavor.

mix.how: Muddle the apricots and simple syrup in a shaker.
Add the Crème de Peche, Chopin Vodka, bitters and ice.
Shake and double strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with a dried apricot.

drinkName.name: Grapefruit Negroni
drinkName.about: Add a brand-new flavor to the classic aperitif.

ingredients.ingredient: Long, wide slice of grapefruit peel
Peeled ruby red grapefruit segments (or 1 oz fresh ruby red grapefruit juice)

mix.how: Fill an Old Fashioned glass with ice, curl the grapefruit peel around the inside of the glass and set aside.
Squeeze the grapefruit segments into a shaker and drop in the fruit.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into the prepared glass.

drinkName.name: Mango Cooler
drinkName.about: Easy, breezy, tropical.

mix.how: Add the ingredients except the soda to a tall glass filled with ice.
Top with soda and garnish with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Tokyo Sidecar
drinkName.about: The Land of the Rising Sun transforms this cognac classic.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled Martini glass.

drinkName.name: Las Fresas
drinkName.about: Complex aged rum makes this easy strawberry cocktail anything but simple.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.

drinkName.name: Le Sang et Sable
drinkName.about: A French take on the classic Scottish Blood and Sand.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into 2 chilled stemmed cordial glasses.
Garnish each with a cocktail cherry and a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Coconut Colada
drinkName.about: Upgrade this tropical rum cocktail with a scoop of coconut sorbet.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled coupe glass or coconut shell.
Garnish with dried coconut flakes.

drinkName.name: Frisky Whiskey
drinkName.about: This Michael Collins Irish Whiskey cocktail has some spunk.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.

drinkName.name: Employees Only Manhattan
drinkName.about: A pair of famed bartenders created this subtle variation on the classic.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir.
Strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Mango Collins
drinkName.about: Island flair meets cocktail tradition.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well until the outside of the shaker is frosty and beaded with sweat.
Strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with club soda and garnish with a mango slice.

drinkName.name: Whisky Skin
drinkName.about: If you’re cold (or you have a cold), make this hot Scotch drink.

mix.how: Rinse a mug or heatproof cup with boiling water to warm it.
Add the sugar and a swatch of thin-cut lemon peel.
Add 1 oz boiling water and stir to dissolve the sugar.
Add the Scotch (see Other information for recommended brands).
Finish by adding 1 oz more of boiling water to bring the heat back up.

drinkName.name: Baileys Irish Margarita
drinkName.about: South of the borderIrish-style.

ingredients.ingredient: Baileys with a Hint of Coffee
Generous scoop of vanilla ice cream (softened)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a blender and fill with ice.
Blend until smooth and pour into a highball glass.

drinkName.name: Banana Nut Bay
drinkName.about: With aged Dominican rum and coconut, banana, peanut and pineapple flavors, it’s about as tropical as you can get.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a tall glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a pineapple slice.

drinkName.name: Corpse Reviver No. 2
drinkName.about: It doesn’t have to be Halloween to enjoy this cocktail.

mix.how: Rinse a chilled coupe or Martini glass with absinthe and set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake.
Strain into the prepared glass.

drinkName.name: Born to Be British
drinkName.about: It’s OK. You can hum “God Save The Queen” to yourself while sipping this cocktail. We won’t tell anyone.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the diced apple and lemon wedges.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with an apple slice.

drinkName.name: Mount Gay Hot Buttered Rum
drinkName.about: A mug of this rich drink will fortify you against the cold and snow.

mix.how: Rinse a coffee mug with boiling water to warm it up.
Add the rum and Buttered Rum Batter to the heated mug.
Top with boiling water and stir well to combine.
Garnish with a cinnamon stick.

drinkName.name: Bee Sting
drinkName.about: The best part? If you like one, you can conjure up a whole swarm.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the bitters to a shaker and shake without ice for about 10 seconds.
Fill with ice and shake again very well for about 30 seconds.
Strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with ice.
Top with the bitters.

drinkName.name: Back Yard Tea
drinkName.about: Drink this easy-to-make rum cocktail on the lawn, porch or patio.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a highball glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a lemon wedge.

drinkName.name: Spicy Grand Margarita
drinkName.about: Red pepper and chile pepper powder make this Margarita almost too hot to handle.

mix.how: Coat the rim of a rocks glass with salt, fill with ice and set aside.
In a shaker, muddle the agave nectar or simple syrup, red pepper flakes and chile powder.
Add the remaining ingredients, fill with ice and shake vigorously.
Strain through a tea strainer into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a jalapeño or red chile pepper.

drinkName.name: Modern English
drinkName.about: Forget that olde tyme English with this cocktail.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle all the ingredients except the gin.
Add the gin and fill with ice.
Shake well and double strain into a Martini or coupe glass.
Garnish with a cinnamon stick.

drinkName.name: Sunset on the Pacific
drinkName.about: Expand your citrus horizons with this tangerine drink.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the tangerine.
Add the tequila and fill with ice.
Shake 20 times and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a kaffir lime leaf.

drinkName.name: Minted Man
drinkName.about: It’ll be the Invisible Man after you taste this cool cocktail.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the simple syrup, cucumber and mint.
Add the vodka and lime juice, and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Bloody Kirby
drinkName.about: Don’t let Mary steal all of the limelight.

ingredients.ingredient: Grey Goose Le Citron Flavored Vodka

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the vodka, cucumber, Tabasco and vermouth. Strain into a rocks glass filled with ice.
Top with the tomato juice and garnish with a Kirby cucumber spear.

drinkName.name: Gold Rush
drinkName.about: Strike it rich with ginger liqueur and bourbon.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with a cherry.

drinkName.name: Chi Chi Organico
drinkName.about: This refreshing coconut and pineapple cocktail is perfect at the beach or for imagining you’re at the beach.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a blender and pulse until smooth.
Serve in a highball glass.

drinkName.name: Bulldog Smash
drinkName.about: This fruity spin on the classic Whiskey Smash is a real winner.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the lemon, peach, mint and sugar cane syrup.
Add the bourbon and Cointreau, and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with crushed ice.
Garnish with a sprig of fresh mint.

drinkName.name: Kiss
drinkName.about: Painted face not required.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with an apple slice.

drinkName.name: Vieux Carré
drinkName.about: The Vieux Carré is pure Old New Orleans and was invented at the city’s famed Carousel Bar. This cognac and rye whiskey cocktail packs a powerful punch and is delightfully complex.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a rocks glass.
Fill with ice and stir.

drinkName.name: Campari Margarita
drinkName.about: A happy marriage of Italy and Mexico.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Margarita glass.

drinkName.name: French 75
drinkName.about: Feeling a little parched during brunch? The French 75 is a sparkling cocktail that’s perfect before, during and after your egg and bacon sandwich. And with the option of rum or gin, this is one classic you’ll want to rediscover again and again.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne into a shaker with ice and shake well.
Strain into a Champagne flute.
Top with the Champagne.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Knob Creek Sour Ginger
drinkName.about: Bourbon and ginger liqueur combine most deliciously in this concoction.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Push a piece of candied ginger into the flesh of a lime wedge, squeeze over the drink and drop it in as a garnish.

drinkName.name: Kew Garden
drinkName.about: Mint and cucumber give this summery sipper a cooling sensation.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the mint leaves, cucumber slices and simple syrup.
Add the rum, lime juice and St-Germain, and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with club soda.
Garnish with a mint sprig poked through a cucumber slice.

drinkName.name: Don Julio’s Bloody Maria
drinkName.about: Who says a Bloody Mary needs to be made with vodka? Try this tequila take on the classic.

mix.how: Rub the lemon wedge along the rim of a highball glass and discard.
Coat the rim with black pepper.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Stir, and garnish with another lemon wedge and skewered cherry tomatoes.

drinkName.name: Tom & Jerry
drinkName.about: Make any day a holiday by fixing a bowl of decadent Tom & Jerry.

mix.how: Rinse a small coffee mug (or, indeed, a white ceramic Tom & Jerry cup) with boiling water to warm it and discard the water.
Add the batter, cognac and rum to the cup and fill with hot milk.
Garnish with a mixture of 2 parts freshly grated nutmeg to 1 part each ground clove and ground allspice.

drinkName.name: Lords-a-Leaping
drinkName.about: This scotch cocktail will warm you up for a night of caroling or any time.

ingredients.ingredient: The Macallan Fine Oak 10-year-old single-malt scotch
Honey syrup (1 part honey, 1 part water)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a coupe glass.
Garnish with grated nutmeg and a Barker & Mills Bourbon Vanilla Cocktail Cherry.

drinkName.name: Hey Bulldog!
drinkName.about: Looking for a way to use up that bottle of peppermint schnapps? Try this holiday gin cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the 7 Up to a highball glass and fill with ice.
Top with 7 Up.

drinkName.name: Holy Smokes
drinkName.about: This complex cocktail will set your heart aflame.

ingredients.ingredient: George Dickel Barrel Select Tennessee Whisky
Ardbeg Uigeadail Single Malt Scotch Whisky

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled small cocktail glass.
Garnish with a flamed orange peel.

drinkName.name: Mount Gay Rum Punch
drinkName.about: This old-timey favorite will keep a whole houseful of guests satisfied.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a punch bowl and stir to combine.
Let stand for 2 hours and serve in punch cups filled with ice.
Garnish each cup with a cherry.

drinkName.name: Peppermint Pattie
drinkName.about: Candy in a glass. Err, on a glass, with a real Peppermint Pattie as garnish.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain the mixture into a chilled Martini glass.
Garnish it with a Peppermint Pattie.

drinkName.name: Presbyterian
drinkName.about: If you treat Scotch like a religion, try this simple and classic cocktail. Be sure to use a spicy ginger ale so you get the most out of the three-part combo. Not a fan of Scotch? The Presbyterian is also delicious with a measure of bourbon.

ingredients.ingredient: Scotch (may substitute bourbon or rye whiskey)

mix.how: Add the Scotch to a Collins glass and fill with ice.
Fill with equal amounts of ginger ale and soda.

drinkName.name: Cider House Rules
drinkName.about: Now this is one set of rules that’s not hard to follow.

mix.how: Coat the rim of a highball glass with cinnamon and fill with ice.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into the prepared glass.

drinkName.name: Infused Tom Collins
drinkName.about: Make this simple drink to show off a fruit- or herb-infused spirit you made yourself.

mix.how: Add the vodka or tequila, lime juice and simple syrup to a highball glass.
Fill with ice and top with soda.
Garnish with a lime wheel and fresh lemon basil leaf.
To serve the drink up, add the vodka or tequila, lime juice and simple syrup to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake quickly and strain into a Champagne flute.
Top with soda (Do not garnish).

drinkName.name: Sergeant Pepper
drinkName.about: Psychedelic marching garb not required.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the apple.
Add the blackcurrants, peppercorns, lime and sugar, and muddle again.
Add the gin and fill with ice.
Shake well and double strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with an apple slice.

drinkName.name: Ginger Rabbit
drinkName.about: After a couple of these spiced bourbon cocktails you’ll be hopping.

ingredients.ingredient: Star Anise and Black Tea Infused Simple Syrup

mix.how: Add the syrup and ginger to a mixing glass.
Twist the lemon peel over the glass to extract the oils.
Drop the peel into the glass and muddle.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.

drinkName.name: An Bodhran (The Drum)
drinkName.about: Have a taste of the Emerald Isle.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake heavily for about a minute and strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with three drops of mint bitters.

drinkName.name: The Sun Also Rises
drinkName.about: Toast Papa Hemingway with this citrusy-and-complex rum concoction.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled coupe glass filled with crushed ice.
